info.title: Ingeniux CMS WebAPI
info.description: The following endpoints are part of the Ingeniux CMS 10.6.378.0 REST WebAPI

500.description: When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown

When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown
or
When the specified Publishing Target doesn't have analytics enabled, or the provider enabled is not the Google Analytics provider, a TypeLoadException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When the specified Publishing Target doesn't have analytics enabled, or the provider enabled is not the Google Analytics provider, a TypeLoadException is thrown

500.description: When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown

When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown
or
When the specified Publishing Target doesn't have analytics enabled, or the provider enabled is not the Google Analytics provider, a TypeLoadException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When passing an invalid Publishing Target ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When the specified Publishing Target doesn't have analytics enabled, or the provider enabled is not the Google Analytics provider, a TypeLoadException is thrown

500.description: When passing an invalid Content Unit ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When passing an invalid Content Unit ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When passing an invalid Content Unit ID an ArgumentException is thrown
When the CustomHooks.cs file cannot be found an ArgumentException is thrown
When an error is encountered retrieving the Custom Macros an ArgumentException is thrown
When an error is encountered running a Custom Macro an HttpResponseException is thrown
When attempting to delete non-root Aliases, ArgumentException is thrown
When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown

When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
or
When Id of the DITA Map provided is invalid, ArgumentException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
When Id of the DITA Map provided is invalid, ArgumentException is thrown

500.description: When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown

When any of the fields has a blank label, ArgumentNullException is thrown
or
When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
or
When "saveGlobally" is true, and current user is not an administrator, InvalidOperationException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When any of the fields has a blank label, ArgumentNullException is thrown
When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
When "saveGlobally" is true, and current user is not an administrator, InvalidOperationException is thrown

500.description: An error occurred updating the localized render schema
An error occurred removing the localized render schema
If the parameter name is not valid according to DITA-OT specs, ArgumentException is thrown

When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
or
If any Assets in the DITA Map collection, including the map itself, is dependent of another DITA Asset, InvalidOperationException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
If any Assets in the DITA Map collection, including the map itself, is dependent of another DITA Asset, InvalidOperationException is thrown

500.description: When any of the Asset were never checked in before and not ready to be marked for publish

When Asset not in workflow, and current user doesn't have the permission to take over content assigned to other users.
or
When Asset in workflow, and current user is not a member in the workflow's current group.

x-expectedSchemas.description: When Asset not in workflow, and current user doesn't have the permission to take over content assigned to other users.
When Asset in workflow, and current user is not a member in the workflow's current group.

500.description: When any Asset has required fields not filled in before check in, ContentFieldFieldValidationException is thrown
When any Assets in the collection is checked out, InvalidOperationException is thrown
When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown

When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, or DITA Root not set or doesn't exist, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
or
When DITAMap Asset doens't exist, ArgumentException is thrown

x-expectedSchemas.description: When no Publishing Targets setup at all in CMS, or DITA Root not set or doesn't exist, ConfigurationErrorsException is thrown
When DITAMap Asset doens't exist, ArgumentException is thrown

parameters.name: unpackzip
parameters.description: Set 'true' when uploading a .zip file to be unpacked into its containing assets.

parameters.name: deleteexistingfolder
parameters.description: For use only with 'unpackzip' option. Deletes already-existing asset folder with same name as .zip, along with all its contents, and creates new asset folder with unpacked .zip contents inside.

parameters.name: zipunpackhandleconflicts
parameters.description: For use only with 'unpackzip' option. Handling conflicts with existing assets in folder.

OTParameterType.description: The object types of parameters for DITA OT processing

IContentItem.description:
Represents the base of a content item object that has the following
properties:
1. Has multiple versions
2. Can be checked out and checked in
3. Contains content including elements and attributes
4. Can be added and advanced in workflow
5. Always created from a Schema
6. Part of a tree structure

ParentId.description: Gets the unique ID of the parent object

SiblingPosition.description: Gets the position of this object among its siblings

_Locale.description:
Gets/sets the locale name of this object, if this object
has language property

StartDate.description: Gets and sets the start date of the page. When set, this page will not be included in navigations when current time is less than the StartDate value.

EndDate.description: Gets and sets the end date of the page. When set, this page will not be included in navigations when current time is greater than the EndDate value.

CanMarkForPublish.description: Controls whether the page is allowed to mark for publish.

CheckedOut.description:
Gets whether this page is checked out. A page has to be checked out to a specific User to be edited.
A page's checked-out content is subject to modification by the assigned User. 
These modifications can only be published if the page is checked in.

NowSyncing.description: Gets whether the page is currently being synchronized to the latest version of the Schema used to create it.

JustSynced.description: Gets whether the page's content was updated via Schema synchronization and hasn't yet been modified directly.

Icon.description: Gets and sets the icon of the page. The value is the numeric representation of the icon images.

AssignedUser.description: Gets the User to whom this page is currently assigned. If the page is not assigned to a user, this method returns null.

AssignedGroup.description: Gets the Group to which this page is currently assigned. If the page is not assigned to a group, this method returns null.

Locale.description: Gets and sets the language of this page.

LocaleInherited.description: Gets whether this page inherits its locale from its ancestor page.

CanParentRegionRoots.description: Gets and sets whether this content item allows region roots (content items with a noninherited locale) when the content item isn't language-neutral.

MasterLingualMap.description: Gets the lingual map between this page and its Master Page.

AssignmentComment.description: Gets the comments from assignments when the page was not in workflow.

CurrentWorkflow.description: Gets the workflow this page is in. If page is not in a workflow, this method returns null.

SecurityInherited.description:
Gets whether this content item has security inherited from 
its parent

SecurityDescriptor.description: Gets the security descriptor of this content item

IUser.description: Represents a user in the Content Store. The Ingeniux CMS CSAPI is an protected environment that requires a user account to create any kind of reading or writing sessions.

IsAdministrator.description: Gets whether the user is an administrator. Administrators have the privilege of working with any object in the CSAPI.

EmailAddress.description: Gets and sets the email address of this User.

IntegratedMembershipProvider.description: Gets and sets the full name of the Type of the provider object that authenticates this user.

ReadLocales.description: Gets and sets the Languages this user can read.

WriteLocales.description: Gets and sets the Languages this user can write.

ReceiveWorkFlowNotificationMail.description: Gets and sets whether this user will receive notification emails after a Page advances through is Workflow.

PageCount.description: Returns the number of pages assigned to a user.

AssetCount.description: Returns the number of assets assigned to a user.

AssignmentCount.description: Returns the number of content items assigned to a user.

UserRights.description: Gets the collection of User Rights for this User.

Activities.description:
Gets the Actities of the user, including its recently visited Pages
and its favorite Pages.

Disabled.description:
Gets/sets whether the user is disabled
Disabled users cannot login until re-enabled

IUserProfile.description: Represents the information of user's publish profile and personal settings

Workphone.description: Gets/sets the user's work phone number

Cellphone.description: Gets/sets the user's cell phone number

PlayNotificationSound.description: Gets/sets whether CMS client will play sound when user receiving notifications

NotificationSoundName.description: Gets/sets the sound name for notifications

DefaultEditFormView.description: Gets/sets the default edit form view choice

DashboardPreferences.description: Gets/sets the visibility of dashboard tiles for the user

EnumEditFormView.description: The list of views for edit form

IAdvancedUserProfile.description: Represents the advanced information of a user's personal settings

AlwaysShowPath.description: If true the 'path' line of content item edit forms will show by default

Theme.description: Gets/sets the theme name for the CMS

DITAOTDebugMode.description: Gets/sets whether to invoke DITA OT in debug mode

DITAMapDetailFields.description: Gets/sets the settings for additional DITA Map detail fields

IDITAMapDetailField.description: Represents the setting entry of a DITA Map detail field

Source.description: Gets/sets where the field value coming from

Name.description: Gets/sets the name the source field that the map detail field gets value from

Label.description: Gets/sets the label of the map detail field

DITAMapDetailInformationSource.description: The choices of DITA Map details information source

ILocale.description:
Represents a standard ISO locale definition. The concept of locale is a combination of language and region.
A more common term to describe a locale is "culture."

LCID.description: Gets the identifier of the locale's underlying culture.
LCID.example: For the locale of "English, United States", the LCID is 1033.

RegionCode.description: Gets the locale's region code. It is the same as the Name property.
RegionCode.example: For the locale of "English, United States", the RegionCode is "en-us".

Name.description: Gets the name of the locale. The name is the same as the RegionCode of the locale.
Name.example: For the locale of "English, United States", the Name value is "en-us".

NativeName.description:
Gets the culture name. This consists of the full name of the language, the full name
of the country/region, and the optional script. 
This name is written in the locale's native language.
NativeName.example: For the locale of "Spanish, Spain" the locale's native name would be "español (España)"

EnglishName.description:
<![CDATA[
   Gets the culture name in the format "<languagefull> (<country/regionfull>)" in
    English, where <languagefull> is the full name of the language and <country/regionfull>
    is the full name of the country/region.
]]>
EnglishName.example: Fore the locale of "Spanish, Spain" the locale's english name would be "Spanish (Spain)"

ISOLanguageName.description: Gets the ISO 639-2 three-letter code for the locale's language.
ISOLanguageName.example: For the locale "en-us", the ISOLanguageName is "eng".

WindowsLanguageName.description: Gets the three-letter code for the language as defined in the Windows API.
WindowsLanguageName.example: For the locale "en-us", the ISOLanguageName is "ENU".

IUserRights.description:
Represents the collection of security permissions for a Group or User.
It contains two enum sections, each of which contains its own collection of permission types.

UserRight1.description: Gets and sets the first section of the permissions.

UserRight2.description: Gets and sets the second section of the permissions.

EnumUserRight.description: The list of permissions in the first section of UserRights

EnumUserRightTwo.description: The list of permissions in the second section of UserRights.

IUserActivities.description: Represents the collection of Pages and Asset Items with which a User interacted.

LastPageId.description: Stores the ID of the last page a User saved

LastPublish.description: The last time this User submitted a publish

FavoritePages.description: Gets the collection of favorite page entries.

FavoriteAssetItems.description: Gets the collection of favorite asset item entries.

RecentPages.description: Gets the collection of Pages that a User has recently visited.

RecentAssetItems.description: Gets the collection of Asset Items that a User has recently visited.

RecentActivities.description: Tracks the recent activities a IUser has performed in the CMS

IUserActivityPageEntry.description: Represents a single activity on a Page by a User.

Name.description: Gets the Name of the Page that was worked on.

Icon.description: Gets the Icon value of the Page that was worked on.

IUserTheme.description: Represents a specific permissions set that is stored and provides a way to set permission on a Group.

Default.description: True if this is the default theme for all users.

System.description: True if this is the system default theme.

Draft.description: If true this theme will be unavailable to non-administrator users.

Colors.description: Returns the theme colors in hex format

Name.description: Gets the name of the color variable

Color.description: Gets/sets the value of the color

IUserGroup.description: Represents a collection of Users that share the same Security Permissions.

UserRights.description: Gets and sets the Security Permissions this group carries.

GroupType.description:
Gets/sets the type name of the group. The type of the group is just arbitrary metadata.
However, it is useful to identify the purpose of the group.

ILingualPageMap.description:
Represents a lingual relation between 2 pages. It includes the information of master and clone pages
unique ids and locales.

MasterPageID.description: Gets the Id of Master Page in this map

ClonePageID.description: Gets the Id of Clone Page in this map

MasterPageLocale.description: Gets the locale of Master Page in this map

ClonePageLocale.description: Gets the locale of Clone Page in this map

CurrentVersionMap.description: Gets the current version map. It is the last version map in the collection

LastFinalizedVersionMap.description: Gets the last version map that was finalized.

ILingualPageVersionMap.description:
Represents the lingual relationship mapping for specific version of the master page. 
This object is an entry in LingualPageMap.


Localization of web pages starts with the source language page (master page). In the beginning, the source language content is finalized and checked in,
but there is no translation of this page in the target language.
This will be the first entry in lingual map of this master page. It has a version for source page, but doesn't have a version for target page yet.
As translation finishes, this lingual version map is finalized. It contains the target language page (clone page)
version number. At this point, this version map is closed and kept in history of the master page's translations.

Owner.description: Gets the owner lingual page map. This object is an entry in the owner's version maps collection

MasterPageVersion.description: Gets the version of the master page. This entry is created for this specific master page version.

InitiationDate.description: Gets the date and time when this entry is created.

InitiationUser.description: Gets the user ID of the User that created this entry

FinalizeInfo.description: Gets the finalization information of this entry. If the translation is not yet finalized, this property is null.

Finalized.description: Gets if this entry is finalized. It will only returns True if the FinalizeInfo exists.

IFinalizeCloneInfo.description:
Represents the information of a page's Lingual Version Map's finalization.
This information is only be available when the lingual version map is finalized.

ClonePageVersion.description: Gets the version of the clone version for the finalization.

FinalizationDate.description: Gets the date and time of finalization.

FinalizationUser.description: Gets the user ID of the User that performed the finalization

IWorkflow.description:
Represents the an instance of a Workflow Definition associated with a single Page.
Once a Page is added to a Workflow, a new instance of the Workflow object is created and attached to the Page.
This allows precise control of the Page's lifecycle. It's also a good way to track the history of actions that occur on the Page.
IWorkflow.example:
Serialization of a Workflow instance matches an entry in the Workflows.xml from previous-generation CMS content:



<WorkFlow Comment="Existing page added to workflow" CurrentStateID="WorkStates/2" 
	TransitionID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" CurrentGroupID="UserGroups/2" 
	WorkFlowDefinitionID="WorkflowDefintions/4" PageID="x1551" Name="News Approval Workflow"/>



Please note that the "Name" attribute value is changed from generic "Page WF (x1551)" to the name of the Workflow Definition.

IsActive.description: Gets whether the workflow's current Work State is active.

Page.description: Gets the Page associated with this workflow.

WorkflowDefinition.description: Gets the Workflow Definition from which the workflow was created.

CurrentWorkState.description: Gets the workflow's current Work State.

AssignedUser.description: Gets the User to whom the Page this workflow holds is assigned.

Locked.description: Gets and sets whether this workflow is in lockdown mode. When a workflow is in lockdown mode, advancing it throws an error.

DontExecuteActions.description: Gets and sets whether or not to execute Actions during a workflow advance.

CurrentGroup.description: Gets the current group to which page assignments are restricted in the current Work State.

Comment.description: Gets the user comments from the last Advancement of this workflow.

DefaultTransition.description: Gets the default transition of this workflow's CurrentWorkState.

IPage.description:
Represents a node in the content tree within a particular Site.
It can be retrieved via Page method from the Site object.


Pages are the building blocks of a CMS Site. Each Page object represents a structured piece of content that represents either a URL on the runtime site or a content block to be included in other pages.
IPage.example:
Example of page serialization output:


            <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
            <Details ID="x9" Name="Terms" IsComponent="false" ViewName="Details">
            	<Title type="string" UID="df5fea71-5d6a-4cd0-a1f1-bc21c7d2e628" label="Title" readonly="false" hidden="true" required="false">Terms of Service</Title>
            	<BodyCopy type="xhtml" UID="2d1c3d20-b7ee-42c6-87d9-5edeacabd31a" label="Body Copy" readonly="true" hidden="false" required="false" Height="">
            		Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat. Pellentesque viverra vehicula sem ut volutpat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut non libero magna. Sed et quam lacus. Fusce condimentum eleifend enim a feugiat.
            	</BodyCopy>
            	<xPower Type="Component" Name="SiteControl" Component="x4" UID="5eacaa24-b25a-4a3a-b38c-ecf2ae2dc241" label="网站通用内容" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" CompTypes="SiteControl" WrappedUp="" AllowWrappingChange="false" componentName="SiteControl" AutoEmbed="false" Embedded="false" />
            	<xPower Type="Navigation" Name="AncestorNavigation" Navigation="Ancestors" UID="d206ba6f-9fca-4e3e-bbf1-151948d7ccd1" label="Ancestor Navigation" readonly="false" hidden="false" required="false" Expanded="false" GenerationOrder="down" StartPage="x2" MaxNodes="" MaxDepth="" Query="" />
            	<IGX_Presentations>
            		<DefaultPresentations />
            		<MobilePresentations />
            	</IGX_Presentations>
            </Details>

CreationSchema.description:
Gets the Schema from which this page was originally created from.
Note that it is normally the same as Schema property value, unless this Page has presentations and created a new Schema with the presentations.

IsComponent.description: Gets whether this page is a component. Components are used as part of other pages, don't have their own URL entries, and don't have specific view or style sheet rendering specified in content.

SerializeOnCheckIn.description: Determines whether to serialize an xID.xml file to the v9 XML root on check-in.

Site.description: Gets the Site object that owns the current page. This Site object was the object in charge of retrieving or creating the current Page object.

RulesInherited.description: Gets and sets whether this page inherits the page creation rule (PCR) settings from its parent page or has its own page creation settings.

PCRDescriptorID.description:
Gets the ID of a page creation rule (PCR) descriptor.
PCR Descriptors are used to mark pages that have specific PCR settings.

ReferenceMapping.description: Retrieves the directly referenced page IDs for this page. This mappings are reference pages added to this page.

ISchema.description:
Represents a schema for a page. All pages in the Ingeniux CMS are created from a schema, which defines page structure. 
However, changes to a schema are not automatically applied to pages created from it.
In order for a page's structure to stay in sync with a schema, you must sync it in schema designer.
ISchema.example:
Schemas are retrieved by the SchemaByID, SchemaByFriendlyName,
and SchemaByRootName methods of the SchemaManager object.



using (IUserSession session = store.OpenReadSession(currentUser))
{
            		ISchemaManager schemaManager = session.SchemasManager;
            		ISchema detailsSchema = schemaManager.SchemaByFriendlyName("Details");
}



Schemas are created with the CreateSchema or CreateComponentSchema
method of the SchemaManager object, or they are imported from XML schema content with the ImportSchema method.



using (IUserSession session = store.OpenWriteSession(currentUser))
{
            		ISchemaManager schemaManager = session.SchemasManager;
            		ISchema newSchema = schemaManager.CreateSchema("NewsDetails", "News Details", 3, false, true, "News_Details");
}



A schema's serialization output matches schema files in previous-generation CMS content:



            <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
            <Schema name="AtoZIndex" xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:xml-data" xmlns:dt="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:datatypes">
            		<AttributeType dt:type="id" name="ID" required="yes" />
            		<AttributeType dt:type="string" name="Name" required="yes" />
            		<AttributeType default="8" dt:type="int" name="Icon" />
            		<AttributeType default="A to Z Index" dt:type="string" name="FriendlyName" />
            		<AttributeType default="true" dt:type="boolean" name="SS" />
            		<AttributeType default="default.xsl" dt:type="string" name="DefaultStyleSheet" />
            		<AttributeType default="" dt:type="string" name="DefaultCategorization" />
            		<AttributeType name="Version" dt:type="int" default="1" />
            		<AttributeType name="UniqueID" dt:type="int" default="57" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" name="Exports" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="Title" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="Abstract" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowergroupstart_SEOGroup" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="NavName">
            			<description>The text used for links in site navigations.  Defaults on page creation to the title.</description>
            		</ElementType>
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="BrowserBarTitle" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="MetaDescription" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="string" name="MetaKeywords" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="enumeration" name="Priority" values=".9 .8 .7 .6 .5 .4 .3 .2 .1" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoFollow" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoIndex" />
            		<ElementType content="textOnly" dt:type="boolean" name="NoODP" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowergroupend" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="dhtml_BodyCopy" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowertaxonomynavigation_ExclusionCategory">
            			<description>Select a category that will exclude tagged items from the A-Z index</description>
            		</ElementType>
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" />
            		<ElementType content="eltOnly" name="AtoZIndex" order="seq">
            			<attribute type="ID" />
            			<attribute type="Name" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Title" readonly="false" required="true" type="Title" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Abstract" readonly="false" required="true" type="Abstract" />
            			<element Expanded="false" hidden="true" label="SEO Group" readonly="false" required="false" type="xpowergroupstart_SEOGroup" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Navigation Name" readonly="false" required="false" type="NavName" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Browser Bar Title" readonly="false" required="false" type="BrowserBarTitle" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Meta Description" readonly="false" required="false" type="MetaDescription" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Meta Keywords" readonly="false" required="false" type="MetaKeywords" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Priority" readonly="false" required="false" type="Priority" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="No Follow" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoFollow" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="No Index" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoIndex" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="No ODP" readonly="false" required="false" type="NoODP" />
            			<element type="xpowergroupend" />
            			<element hidden="false" label="Body Copy" readonly="false" required="false" type="dhtml_BodyCopy" />
            			<element Depth="" FilterParentPages="" FilterSchemas="" IncludePages="false" StartNodes="" hidden="false" label="Exclusion Category" readonly="false" required="false" type="xpowertaxonomynavigation_ExclusionCategory" />
            			<element Expanded="false" GenerationOrder="down" MaxDepth="" MaxNodes="" Navigation="Ancestors" Query="" StartPage="x2" hidden="true" label="Ancestor Navigation" readonly="true" required="false" type="xpowernavigation_AncestorNavigation" />
            			<element CompTypes="SiteControl" Component="x10" hidden="true" label="Site Control" readonly="true" required="false" type="xpowercomponent_SiteControl" />
            		</ElementType>
            </Schema>

RuntimeIndexable.description:
Gets/sets whether the Schema should be indexed at Runtime.
This property will instruct the Runtime content indexing system for searches, to include the Schema for indexing or not.

ISite.description:
Represents the manager object that provides the means to query and manage Pages and Page Versions.


It is the most important manager, due to fact it manages the central pieces of CMS, the Pages.
ISite.example:
Serialization of Site matches the serialization of reference.xml in previous-generation CMS content:



            <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
            <Site ID="x1" Name="Content Store" CheckedOut="false" SCID="Schema_Folder" SCV="1" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="Folder" PageType="0" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140529T15:16:00" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140625T09:53:15" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59" SiteBaseUrl="" xmlns="x-schema:siteSchema.xml">
            	<Page ID="x3" Name="Site" CheckedOut="false" SCID="Schema_Folder" SCV="1" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="Folder" PageType="1" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140529T16:11:45" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140625T09:53:15" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59">
            		<Page ID="x2" Name="Home" CheckedOut="true" SCID="schemas/23" SCV="5" AssignedUser="ingeniux\awang" AssignedGroup="" Schema="Home" PageType="7" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140529T16:03:08" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140710T09:42:16" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\awang" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59">
            			<Page ID="x34" Name="Products" CheckedOut="false" SCID="schemas/28" SCV="6" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="ProductFront" PageType="8" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140602T15:50:27" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140619T16:52:37" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59">
            				<Page ID="x43" Name="Cartella" CheckedOut="false" SCID="schemas/27" SCV="6" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="ProductDetail" PageType="8" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140603T14:46:10" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140612T11:22:29" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\admin1" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59" />
            				<Page ID="x44" Name="CMS" CheckedOut="false" SCID="schemas/27" SCV="6" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="ProductDetail" PageType="8" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140603T15:02:29" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140612T11:22:29" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\admin1" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59" />
            			</Page>
            			<Page ID="x41" Name="Solutions" CheckedOut="false" SCID="schemas/31" SCV="3" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="SolutionsFront" PageType="8" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140603T14:21:21" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140603T16:14:55" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59">
            				<Page ID="x47" Name="Mainstream" CheckedOut="false" SCID="schemas/30" SCV="3" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="SolutionsDetail" PageType="8" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140603T15:42:05" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140603T16:14:55" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59" />

 <Page ID="RecycleBin" Name="Recycle Folder" CheckedOut="false" SCID="Schema_Folder" SCV="1" AssignedUser="" AssignedGroup="" Schema="Folder" PageType="1" Locale="" LocaleInherited="true" Created="20140529T15:16:01" CreatedBy="ingeniux\ashley" Changed="20140701T21:16:14" LastChangedBy="ingeniux\ashley" StartDate="00010101T00:00:00" EndDate="99991231T23:59:59" />
            </Site>

SiteVersion.description: Gets the Version information of the Site Instance. It is the version of the site's assemblies in "bin" folder.

VersionsLimit.description:
Gets/sets the limit of Page Versions to be kept on each Page.
Older Page Versions are automatically removed from Content Store if this settings is set.

CustomTabsConfig.description: Gets the Operating User's Custom Tabs configuration.

TinyMceConfig.description: Gets the Operating User's XHTML editor configuration.

ToolbarConfig.description: Gets the Operating User's CMS top toolbar configuration.

TreeMenuConfig.description: Gets the Operating User's Site Tree context menu configuration.

WorldViewSettings.description: Gets the settings on WorldView features

XmlDirectoryPath.description: Gets the full path of "App_Data/xml" folder of the Site Instance

ICustomTabsConfig.description: Represents the configuration for the Custom Tabs system in CMS.

ITinyMceConfig.description: Represents a manager for Tiny MCE User and Group configuration profiles.

TemplateProfile.description: Get the template Tiny MCE Profile.

DefaultProfile.description: Get the default Tiny MCE Profile.

ITinyMceTemplate.description: Represents the Tiny MCE Profile for XHTML Editor Basic Settings.

SupportHTML5.description: Gets and sets if HTML5 is supported for the Tiny MCE Editor.

SupportHTML5CustomDataAttributes.description: Gets and sets if custom HTML5 data attributes are supported for the Tiny MCE Editor.

ForcedRootBlock.description: Gets and sets the Forced Root Block Tag.

VerifyHtml.description: Gets and sets whether the Tiny MCE Editor should verify HTML elements and attributes.

EntityEncoding.description: Gets and sets the entity encoding for the Tiny MCE Editor. Options are: named entities, numeric entities, or raw characters.

ExtendedValidElements.description: Gets and sets the extended valid elements that can be used to override standard element attributes.

InvalidElements.description: Gets and sets the invalid elements that will be automatically removed by the XHTML editor. This is null by default.

ITinyMceGroupProfile.description: Represents a Tiny MCE profile for a CMS Group that stores the Group's XHTML Editor configuration Settings.

Name.description: Gets the name of the Tiny MCE profile.

Id.description: Gets the Tiny MCE profile's ID number.

GroupId.description: Gets the Group ID number associated with the Tiny MCE profile.

Default.description: Gets if this is the Default Tiny MCE profile.

ConfigJSON.description: Gets the JSON overrides for the XHTML editor.

Plugins.description: Gets a list of all the plugins configured for this Tiny MCE profile.

BlockFormats.description: Gets a list of all the block formats enabled for this Tiny MCE profile.
BlockFormats.example: Names of possible block formats include: Address, Block Quote, Div, Paragraph, and Preformatted.

HeadingFormats.description: Gets a list of all the heading formats enabled for this Tiny MCE profile.

Fonts.description: Gets a list of all the fonts enabled for this Tiny MCE profile.
Fonts.example: Names of possible fonts include: Arial, Times New Roman, etc.

FontSizes.description: Gets a list of all the font sizes enabled for this Tiny MCE profile.

TableCssClass.description: Gets a list of all the CSS classes enabled for tables in the XHTML Editor.
TableCssClass.example: Names of possible CSS classes include: No JS, Plain Table, and Table Scroller.

LinkCssClass.description: Gets a list of all the CSS classes enabled for links in the XHTML Editor.
LinkCssClass.example: Names of possible CSS classes include: White Link and Arrow Link.

ImageCssClass.description: Gets a list of all the CSS classes enabled for images in the XHTML Editor.
ImageCssClass.example: Names of possible CSS classes include: Full Width.

RemoveButtons.description: Gets a list of buttons to remove from the XHTML Editor.

CommandRow.description: Gets an ordered collection of button items representing the command row for the XHTML Editor.

ContentCssFile.description: Gets a file path where a custom CSS configuration file is located on the server relative to the XML directory.

IgxSmartPaste.description: Gets the value of the IgxSmartPaste setting for this profile.

IToolbarConfig.description: Represents a manager for the Ingeniux CMS client toolbar User and Group configuration profiles.

IToolbarConfigProfile.description: Represents the Group-specific configuration of the Ingeniux CMS client toolbar

Buttons.description: Gets the List of Button that will show up on the toolbar

Type.description: Gets the type of configuration profile this is. It is one of the three types:  Template, Default, or Group.

GroupId.description:
Gets the Id of the Group this profile is for. If the Type is not
"Group", this value doesn't matter.

TextOption.description: Gets and sets the text option for the toolbar. Default value is "0".

IconOption.description: Gets and sets the icon option for the toolbar. Default value is "0".

IToolbarButton.description: Represents a button on the Ingeniux CMS client toolbar.

Name.description: Gets the Name/Label of the button.

IsDisplayed.description: Gets whether this button will be visible or hidden.

IsSeparator.description: Gets whether this button is a real functional button or just a spacer between buttons.

ITreeMenuConfig.description:
Represents a manager for the Ingeniux CMS Page / Asset
Tree Menus' User and Group configuration profiles.

ITreeMenuProfile.description: Represents the Group-specific configuration of the Ingeniux CMS tree.

Type.description: Gets the type of tree menu profile this is. It is one of the three types:  Template, Default, or Group.

GroupId.description:
Gets the Id of the Group this profile is for. If the Type is not
"Group", this value doesn't matter.

Children.description: Gets the list of tree menu item children of the profile.

ITreeMenuItem.description: Represents a menu item in the Ingeniux CMS Page or Asset trees.

Name.description: Gets the name/label of the menu item.

Caption.description: Gets the caption for the menu item.

Icon.description: Gets the name of the icon to display next to the menu item's label.
Icon.example: A asset folder would use the "ImageFile" icon.

IsDisplayed.description: Gets and sets whether this menu item will be visible or hidden.

HasSubMenu.description: Gets and sets if this menu item has a submenu.
HasSubMenu.example: This would be true for an Asset Folder containing a number of Assets.

IsSeparator.description: Gets whether this is a real menu item or just a spacer between menu items.

Children.description: Gets a list of this menu item's children.If this menu item doesn't have a sub menu, this will be an empty list.

ISettings.description: Represents the collection of settings of a Ingeniux CMS site instance.

IAsset.description:
Represents an asset in the Assets Tree within a particular Site.
It can be retrieved via Asset method from the Site object.
IAsset.example:
Example of asset serialization output:


<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">
<rdf:Description rdf:about="baby-sloth" xmlns:igx="http://ingeniux.com/xmp/" xmlns:xmp="http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/" xmlns:stDim="http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/sType/Dimensions#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" igx:SchemaRootName="Image" igx:AssetType="Image" igx:dpi="96" igx:colors="24" xmp:CreateDate="1/17/2017 2:58:12 PM" xmp:ModifyDate="1/17/2017 2:58:12 PM" stDim:w="768" stDim:h="511" dc:Coverage="" dc:Format="" dc:Publisher="">
<dc:Contributor>
  <rdf:Bag>
    <rdf:li />
  </rdf:Bag>
</dc:Contributor>
<dc:Creator>
  <rdf:Bag>
    <rdf:li />
  </rdf:Bag>
</dc:Creator>
<dc:Rights>
  <rdf:Alt>
    <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default" />
    <rdf:li xml:lang="iv" />
  </rdf:Alt>
</dc:Rights>
<dc:Subject>
  <rdf:Alt>
    <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default" />
    <rdf:li xml:lang="iv" />
  </rdf:Alt>
</dc:Subject>
<dc:Title>
  <rdf:Alt>
    <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default" />
    <rdf:li xml:lang="iv" />
  </rdf:Alt>
</dc:Title>
<dc:Description>
  <rdf:Alt>
    <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default" />
    <rdf:li xml:lang="iv" />
  </rdf:Alt>
</dc:Description>
</rdf:Description>
</rdf:RDF>

AssetContentDetailType.description: Gets the details types from asset content

NonXmpMetadata.description:
Gets whether the asset will publish xmp metadata
When false, the metadata published out will be just like page xml, and under "_asset_metadata_" 
instead xmp folder

FileName.description: Gets the name of the file associated with the current version of the asset. Does not provide the extension of the file.
FileName.example:
Example of replacing a string in the file name in the OnNew custom hook:


    contentItem.Name = contentItem.FileName.Replace("-", "_");

Extension.description: Gets the extension of the file associated with the current version of the asset.

IsExternal.description: Checks whether the asset is referencing an external asset.

ExternalUrl.description: Gets the External URL of the asset. The External URL is dynamically generated by the path of the asset in the Assets Tree.

ViewBound.description:
Checks whether the asset is view bound.
View bound assets are views that are attached to Presentation 
Content Units and are published automatically.

SourceEditionId.description:
Gets the current Source Edition Id for the content item.
Assets are connected as Source Editions when they are edited in the CMS and saved using Save As.

AncestorEditionIds.description:
Gets the collection of SourceEditionId strings of all ancestor editions of the content item.
Assets are connected as Source Editions when they are edited in the CMS and saved using Save As.

NeedsEdit.description:
Checks whether the asset is flagged as needing edits.
Newly uploaded images are flagged as needing edits until they are checked in or removed from queue.

NonRuntimeIndexable.description: Gets/sets whether this asset can be picked up by InSite search content index.

DITATitle.description: If DITA Asset gets the title value

IWorkflowDefinition.description:
Represents a definition of workflow. Defines a Transitions tree/loop to move 
Pages through, the Users to assign page to, and the Actions to perform on these transitions.
IWorkflowDefinition.example:
Serialization of a workflow defintion matches a definition entry in the workflowdefinitions.xml file in previous-generation CMS site content:



	<WorkFlowDefinition Description="Used to track News Articles submitted through the website's entry form." 
			ID="WorkflowDefintions/1" Name="Anonymous News Submission">
		<Transitions>
			<Transition AllowNextGroupToAdvance="false" CurrentStateID="WorkStates/1" DefaultUserID="" Description="" 
					ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/1_1" IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/3" 
					NextStateID="WorkStates/2" ToolbarIcon="" Trigger="OnCreate">
				<Actions NextID="1"/>
			</Transition>
			<Transition CurrentStateID="WorkStates/2" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" 
					IsDefault="true" Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/4" NextStateID="WorkStates/3" Trigger="OnCreate">
				<Actions NextID="4">
					<Action ID="action_1" Type="MarkForPublish"/>
					<Action ID="action_2" Type="CheckIn"/>
					<Action ID="action_3" Type="Republish"/>
				</Actions>
			</Transition>
		</Transitions>
	</WorkFlowDefinition>

Description.description: Gets and sets the description of this Workflow Definition.

Transitions.description: Gets the collection of Transitions that belong to this Workflow Definition.

ITransition.description:
Represents a path between two Work States. When a Workflow
advances from one workstate to another, it goes through a transition.


Transitions allow for ownership change of a page in workflow. Transitions can also can execute built-in or custom Actions.


Transitions are defined in Workflow Definitions and carried out in 
Workflow Instances.
ITransition.example:
Serialization of a transition instance matches the transition entries in the workflowdefinitions.xml file in previous-generation CMS content:



            <Transition CurrentStateID="WorkStates/1" Description="" ID="WorkflowTransition_WorkflowDefinitions/33_1" IsDefault="true" 
            		Name="Initial" NextGroupID="UserGroups/4" NextStateID="WorkStates/4" Trigger="OnCreate">
 <Actions NextID="4">
            		<Action ID="action_1" Type="MarkForPublish"/>
            		<Action ID="action_2" Type="CheckIn"/>
            		<Action ID="action_3" Type="Republish"/>
 </Actions>
            </Transition>

Description.description: Gets and sets the description of transition.

IsDefault.description: Gets and sets whether the transition is the default for a given Work State.

AssignToGroupOnly.description: Gets and sets whether the transition only assigns the Page to a Group.

DisallowDefaultUserOverride.description:
Gets and sets whether a Page can be assigned to a different User, 
but only if the Default User is specified in this transition.

AllowNextGroupToAdvance.description: Gets and sets whether  Members of the next group in the transition can advance the page.

Actions.description: Gets the collection of Actions in this transition.

DefaultUser.description:
Gets and sets the default User to whom to assign the Page in Workflow when
the transition advances to the next workstate.
The transition doesn't automatically assign the Page to this User; 
It is only a recommendation from the transition on whom should be assigned the Page.

NextGroup.description:
Gets and sets the next Group to which page assignments are restricted when the transition advances to the next workstate.
The DefaultUser must be a member of this group.

CurrentState.description:
Gets and sets the Work State before the Workflow advances through this transition.
Transition is only available for Workflow to advance through, if Workflow is currently on this Work state.

NextState.description: Gets and sets the Work State that the Workflow will be on after advancing through this transition.

Definition.description: Gets the Workflow Definition to which this transition belongs.

Trigger.description: Gets and sets the type of Trigger associated with this transition. Decides where the transition is executed.

UIParameters.description:
Gets the behavior settings on for transitions on the Ingeniux CMS user interface.
Actual changes will be performed on the property value.
These settings decide this Workflow's icon on the toolbar, the "Advance" button drop-down menu, and the enter/exit prompt dialogs settings.

IAction.description:
Represents a task to be completed when a transition is executed. 
An action is associated with a transition through the  method. 


There are actions for common operations in the content tree, such as checking in a page and marking a page for publish. 
If the built-in actions are not adequate, developers can create custom workflow actions. 
Custom workflow actions assemblies must be put in App_Data/xml/custom/plugins/CustomWorkflowActions directory. The actual Action class must implement the
 interface. The custom action uses its full class name as the value of the ProgID attribute and calls the Execute method to perform the action.


The actions associated with a transition are executed in the order in which they are added to the transition. 
If an action fails to execute, the transition will not complete. The workflow remains in the WorkState it was in before the transition executed.
IAction.example:
Serialization of the Action object matches the Action elements in the WorkflowDefinitions.xml file in the last-generation CMS:


<Action ID="action_3" Description="Republish site" Type="Republish" PubTarget="PublishingTargets/2"/>


The difference is that the system no longer stores names of entities as identifiers. For example, the PubTarget attribute of Republish action is now storing the PubTarget ID instead of the name.

Description.description: Gets and sets the description of the workflow action.

Type.description: Gets and sets the workflow action type.

EnumActionType.description: The list of Action types for a Workflow Transition

IAttribute.description:
Represents an attribute in Page or Element content, 
or in a Workflow Action. Attributes are always uniquely named.
Attribute objects are already serialized into an XAttribute object.

Name.description: Gets the name of the attribute

Value.description: Gets and sets the value of the attribute

Readonly.description: Gets and sets the Element as read-only on the Edit Form.

Hidden.description: Gets and sets the Element as hidden on the Edit Form.

Required.description: Gets sets the Element's value as required. Pages containing required Elements with empty values cannot be checked in.

Indexable.description: Gets/sets the Element as indexable after publish

IWorkState.description:
Represents a stage of a Workflow. 
Transitions push a Page from one workstate to another.
IWorkState.example: Serialization of a workstate matches a workstate entry in the workflowdefinitions.xml file in previous-generation CMS site content:

Icon.description: Gets and sets the icon of a workstate. For visual editing only.

IsActive.description:
Gets and sets whether this workstate is active.
The CMS uses this property to filter inactive Pages from a 
user's assignments pane. If a the workstate page currently on is not active, a user won't see it in the assignments pane.

Description.description: Gets and sets the description of the workstate.

EnumTrigger.description: The list of trigger types; these define when the trigger is executed and are related to an Entity's livecycle.

ITransitionUserInterface.description:
Represents the settings for user-interface behavior when the transition is executed.
This includes the toolbar icons and the enter/exit dialog settings.

ToolbarIcon.description: Gets and sets the toolbar icon. If set, the icon appears in the "Advance in Workflow" toolbar button's drop-down menu item for this transition.

OnEnterPrompt.description: Gets and sets the message that displays in the dialog before transition execution starts.

OnExitPrompt.description: Gets and sets the message that displays in the dialog before transition execution ends.

ISecurityDescriptor.description: Represents a security descriptor for a page or content item.

EnumNodeLevelPermission.description: The list of node-level permissions for Pages

EnumUrlMapPageHistoryType.description: The list of types of history entry for one specific Page in a URL Map

EnumElementType.description: Represents the list of field types on a Page.

AssetType.description: The list of types of Asset

EnumCopyActions.description:
Represents the collection of positions where a Page can be placed
in the site tree when moving or copying a Page
